content.description:
Start in the back of the cave past "

In Rainbows

", and make your way out the flaring crack on a jug rail, some hand jams, and fists.
content.location:
It is just left of "

In Rainbows

."

content.description: Sit start with good hand holds. Pull through sinker fingers with great feet until the crack pinches down just in time for the dirty topout.
content.location:
It is just West and uphill from

In Rainbows

.

climbs.name: In Rainbows
climbs.fa: FKA: Tyler Dziedzina, Autumn the German Shepard

content.description:
This boulder problem is a total classic, SPLITTER finger to hand crack. Sit start in the finger crack, work your way up to a strenuous, lockoff crux sequence, then gain the hands to the top. Really one of the best crack boulders in the S. Platte, this one had me smiling from ear to ear.

This is harder if you are shorter or have smaller fingers.

Stemming on the back wall is obviously "off".

This is still cleaning up. I did not finish this problem.

The problem starts sitting with two flared jams in the white crack. I put my right foot in the crack about where it tapers off above a dead plant. I do a dynamic move to a right flared jam, move feet up, then go up to the next crack with my left. Do a large move to a flared right jam, and top out. The topout needs to be cleaned as it is pretty dirty.

If you finish the route, I'll change the name to whatever and add in your FA. I am just putting this on the DB to get more people out here!
content.location: As you approach in rainbows, you will see this flared crack.
